lexUnit.name: pullover.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a knitted garment put on over the head and covering the top half of the body.

sentence.text: Always take at least one heavy , woollen pullover with you , and a warm waterproof jacket .
Theodora saw he was a small-bodied , long-legged boy with straight reddish-brown hair , dressed in stained fawn jodhpurs and a black pullover with holes in both elbows .
She was wearing a short skirt with a big broad belt , a soft woollen pullover with a deep V-neck and a double string of pearls .
And Goldberg , pushing the sweat out of his eyes with the sleeve of his pullover , grabbed the pen and put another question mark in the margin by the whole passage .
Ordering coffee she then pointed to my pullover and shook her finger .
I knew she did n't like my roll-neck pullover .
There was just one customer being served , a tall man in a chunky cream pullover .
Karen did n't dress well , trying unsuccessfully to disguise her wolfish sexuality with lambswool pullovers and flowery skirts .
He smoothed out a couple of folds in his best V-necked lambswool pullover , and slipped it over his head .
She dressed in an unvarying uniform of black ski pants and pink mohair pullover which became grubbier as the weeks passed .
Patterned Fair Isle yoke pullovers came in at this time , then polo necks .
He was aware of his jumper being pulled up and then felt the pullover against the back of his neck and something around the front .
She was sitting at a littered table with two noisy West Indians in colourful pullovers and a jaded , almost middle-aged fat lady with a fur coat .

Both sexes were clad in essentially masculine garments which looked as though they had been in the family for generations : waxed jackets , sensible shoes , chunky pullovers , indestructible tweeds and cords .
He was a thin lad , dressed in dark short trousers and a grey pullover .
The TV producer led them to one of the last suites on the left and a young man in pullover and jeans swung round on his chair .
Baldoni was a pudgy , balding man wearing a blue blazer with five silver buttons , a canary-yellow pullover and a red tie .
When he felt brave enough he took off the old pullover and the tracksuit pants that he 'd been sleeping in and started to dress .
He still wore the grey flannel trousers , white shirt and maroon pullover of his school , but his feet were bare .
The sparkling white pullover and newly pressed black corduroys were designed to project an image of calm sophistication .
She was dressed in tight jeans and a loose white pullover .
Suzy peeled off her white pullover .
One man in a clean white polo-necked pullover unbent from the cockpit as she passed .
I wear long-sleeved pullovers and hope no one will notice that only the cuffs and collars of my shirts have been pressed .
An Irishman said , for no apparent reason , ` I wear a green pullover because in Ireland we have green sheep . "
Above them , as far as it was possible to see for the blood , he wore a striped knitted pullover over a navy jumper .
He wore a light-blue , Fair Isle pullover , fawn slacks and grey trainers .
He was wearing a long woolly pullover with hedgehogs all over it , nothing else .
Over his pyjamas he had put on a new Fair Isle pullover which had been his mother 's Christmas present .
Consequently , I would often choose a fleece pullover or jacket which has a windproof cover .
The Fair Isle pullover had given way to another in pale blue and the firelight struck almost red notes from his hair .
